title: Roman Spring Vegetable Stew
introduction: Romans embrace the changing seasons with the arrival of the first spring artichokes, marking the end of winter and heralding warmer days. This Roman Spring Vegetable Stew, featuring artichokes, celebrates this transition with a vibrant blend of seasonal vegetables.
ingredients: 1 pound fresh fava beans, shelled, or 1 cup frozen fava or lima beans
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: 1. In a large frying pan, cook the pancetta in the oil over medium heat. Stir frequently until the pancetta begins to brown, about 5 minutes. Add the onion and cook until golden, about 10 minutes more.

2. Add the artichokes, fava beans, broth, and salt and pepper to taste. Lower the heat. Cover and cook for 10 minutes or until the artichokes are almost tender when pierced with a knife. Add the peas and parsley and cook for 5 minutes more. Serve hot or at room temperature.
